text: The oxidative decarboxylation of pyruvate, coupled to CoA incorporation, is performed by an unusually large multisubunit enzyme called the pyruvate molecular player to direct sugar catabolism into respiration.
Other pathways are detailed Pyruvate is converted to acetyl-CoA through removal decarboxylation.
Acetyl phosphate is a global signal of the nutritional environment.
Bacteria and archaea use at least ten known variations on environmental conditions.
You will no doubt be relieved to hear that we present only one: the Krebs pathway, which is found in most Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria, and in most eukaryotes.
